Description: Rim sherd (mended from four fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup with root of handle on right; interior: reserved at rim, glazed black below; pair of faded added red bands lower down; exterior: black band at top of rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of maenad and satyr to left (of maenad, head, part of upper torso, left arm except hand; added white on black for face, red dabs on hair, possibly a wreath, red on garment, and white arm on clay ground; upper body of satyr with red hair and beard; on right trace of hasty black handle surround.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0621) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
